mrilab documentation¶

mrilab.brain¶

mrilab.preprocessing¶

mrilab.preprocessing.dir_to_filelist(directory, ending='.nii')[source]¶

Function to read all file names with a given ending from a directory into a list.

Parameters:
  • directory – {str} path of directory from which files should be read
  • ending – {str} file ending to consider
Returns:

array of file names in this directory
mrilab.preprocessing.fnames_to_targets(directory, extension='.nii')[source]¶

Function to read all filenames from the given directory and connect them in a dictionary to the corresponding target values, which must be stored in a file called ‘targets.csv’ and located in the same directory. The file names must have the format “<something>_ID.<ending>” with ID corresponding to the row ID in the targets.csv file.

Parameters:
  • directory – {str} path of directory from which files should be read
  • extension – {str} file name extension to consider
Returns:

a dictionary with file names as keys and targets as values
mrilab.preprocessing.get_img_matrix(filename, slices=None)[source]¶

Function to read a nifti img into numpy pixel vectors

Parameters:
  • filename – {str} file name of the MRI img to read
  • slices – {int} default: None (load all); whether the function should only load slices slices of the nifti image.
Returns:

numpy array with all slices as pixel matrices
mrilab.preprocessing.image_to_vector(img)[source]¶

Function to flatten an img into a vector.

Parameters:img – {img array} image to be reshaped into array
Returns:{np.array} vectorized image
mrilab.preprocessing.slice_mri(img)[source]¶

Function to get all horizontal slices of a nifit img, flatten them into vectors and store them in a matrix.

Parameters:img – {img matrix} nifti img as 3D pixel matrix
Returns:{np.array} matrix with pixel vectors of every slice
mrilab.preprocessing.files_to_data(file_dict, directory, num=None, slices=None)[source]¶

Function to generate a data and target array from a dictionary containing file names (keys) and target values (values).

Parameters:
  • file_dict – {dict} dictionary containing file names as keys and corresponding target values as values.
  • directory – {str} directory from which files in file_dict should be loaded.
  • num – {int} how many files should be read (random order, meant for testing purposes).
  • slices – {int} default: None (load all); whether the function should only load slices slices of the nifti image.
Returns:

two vectors: data array and target array.
mrilab.preprocessing.get_standard_brain(x, num=278)[source]¶

Evaluate every slice over all brains and return the “standard deviation brain” with stdevs as pixel values

Parameters:
  • x – {numpy.array} array with every slice as linear vector of pixels, original shape (176,208)
  • num – {int} number of brains in x_train
Returns:

Brain array containing stdev values of all input brains in x_train and an array containing the important pixel indices for each slice.
mrilab.preprocessing.reduce_data_by_indexbrain(x, index_brain, y=None, num=278)[source]¶

Extract the pixels most different in all brains (given in “indexbrain”) from every slice of x_train.

Parameters:
  • x – {numpy.array} training data to reduce
  • y – {numpy.array} target values for training data
  • index_brain – {numpy.array} output from get_standard_brain() with important pixel indices
  • num – {int} number of brains in x_train (each brain has 176 slices)
Returns:

reduced data x to important pixels.

mrilab.convolve¶

mrilab.convolve.convolve_image(img, filters, plot=False)[source]¶

Function to convolve an image with given filters and return the convoluted image.

Parameters:
  • img – {numpy.array} image pixel matrix to convolve
  • filters – {list} list of filter matrices to use for convolution
  • plot – {bool} whether to plot the resulting convoluted images
Returns:

{numpy.array} convoluted image
